Package org.CAP5400.Image

Class Image

java.lang.Object
org.CAP5400.Image.Image
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class Image extends Object implements AutoCloseable
This class represents an image object. The image object is a 3D array of pixels. The first dimension represents the rows, the second dimension represents the columns, and the third dimension represents the channels. The image object can be created from a file or from scratch. The image object can be saved to a file.

NOTE: This class uses the OpenCV library to read and write images and deploys the observer design pattern. Every time a pixel value is changed, the observers are notified.

    • Image

      public Image(@Positive @jakarta.validation.constraints.Positive int rows, @Positive @jakarta.validation.constraints.Positive int columns, @Positive @jakarta.validation.constraints.Positive int channels)
      Overloaded constructor that creates an empty image object based on the rows, columns, and channels
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the image
      columns - The number of columns in the image
      channels - The number of channels in the image

    • Image

      public Image(@Positive @jakarta.validation.constraints.Positive int rows, @Positive @jakarta.validation.constraints.Positive int columns)
      Overloaded constructor that creates an empty image object based on the rows and columns. This is used for grayscale images.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the image
      columns - The number of columns in the image

    • Image

      public Image(@NotNull @NotNull Image image)
      Overloaded constructor that creates an empty image object based another image object.
      Parameters:
      image - The image object to be copied

    • Image

      public Image(@NotNull @NotBlank @NotEmpty @NotNull @NotBlank @NotEmpty String fileName) throws Exception
      Overloaded constructor that creates an image object based on the file name. This constructor opens the image file while checking for the correct extension and verifying that the file exists.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the image file. The file must have a .pgm or .ppm extension.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the file does not exist or the extension is incorrect.

  • Method Details

    • getPixel

      public int getPixel(int row, int column, int channel) throws Exception
      This method returns the pixel value at the specified row, column, and channel.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the pixel
      column - The column of the pixel
      channel - The channel of the pixel
      Returns:
      The pixel value at the specified row, column, and channel
      Throws:
      Exception - If the row, column, or channel is out of bounds for the image

    • getPixel

      public int getPixel(int row, int column) throws Exception
      This method returns the pixel value at the specified row and column. This method is used for grayscale images.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the pixel
      column - The column of the pixel
      Returns:
      The pixel value at the specified row and column
      Throws:
      Exception - If the row or column is out of bounds for the image or the image is not grayscale

    • setPixel

      public void setPixel(int row, int column, int channel, int value) throws Exception
      This method sets the pixel value at the specified row, column, and channel.

      NOTE: The observer is notified when this method is called. If more than 50 pixels are changed, it might be better to use the deep copy method.

      Parameters:
      row - The row of the pixel
      column - The column of the pixel
      channel - The channel of the pixel
      value - The value to be set
      Throws:
      Exception - If the row, column, or channel is out of bounds for the image

    • setPixel

      public void setPixel(int row, int column, int value) throws Exception
      This method sets the pixel value at the specified row and column. This method is used for grayscale images.

      NOTE: The observer is notified when this method is called. If more than 50 pixels are changed, it might be better to use the deep copy method.

      Parameters:
      row - The row of the pixel
      column - The column of the pixel
      value - The value to be set
      Throws:
      Exception - If the row or column is out of bounds for the image or the image is not grayscale

    • isInBounds

      public boolean isInBounds(int row, int column, int channel)
      This method checks if the specified row, column, and channel is in bounds for the image.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the pixel
      column - The column of the pixel
      channel - The channel of the pixel
      Returns:
      True if the specified row, column, and channel is in bounds for the image, false otherwise

    • isInBounds

      public boolean isInBounds(int row, int column)
      This method checks if the specified row and column is in bounds for the image.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the pixel
      column - The column of the pixel
      Returns:
      True if the specified row and column is in bounds for the image, false otherwise

    • getOpenCvMat

      public org.opencv.core.Mat getOpenCvMat(String colorSpace, int channel) throws Exception
      This method returns the OpenCV Mat object of the image based on the specified color space and channel.
      Parameters:
      colorSpace - The color space of the image. Only "hsv" and "rgb" are supported.
      channel - The channel of the image
      Returns:
      The OpenCV Mat object of the image based on the specified color space and channel
      Throws:
      Exception - If the color space is not supported
